issue.title: GPS Fix estimation (dead reconing, RTH without GPS fix) for fixed wing
issue.body:
# GPS Fix estimation (dead reconing, RTH without GPS fix) for fixed wing

Video demonstration

[![IMAGE ALT TEXT HERE](https://img.youtube.com/vi/wzvgRpXCS4U/0.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wzvgRpXCS4U)

There is possibility to allow plane to estimate it's position when GPS fix is lost.
The main purpose is RTH without GPS.
It works on fixed wing only.

Up-to-date description:
https://github.com/RomanLut/inav/blob/submit-gps-fix-estimation/docs/GPS_fix_estimation.md

This submit also contains the following submit requests:
https://github.com/iNavFlight/inav/pull/8856
https://github.com/iNavFlight/inav/pull/8857
https://github.com/iNavFlight/inav/pull/8858

comment.body:

Resolved

issue.title: Mamba H743 V2 with ICM-42688 P Dual Gyro
issue.body: I have flashed this with iNav 6.1 Mamba H743 2022B and I notice that this gyro is not available in the drop downs in the configurator. It is responding to movement when I use ICM 42605. Is it safe or wise to use this? I assumed that ICM 42688 has been around for a while now so I assumed it would be supported in iNav -- or are the gyro options specified for each target? Can we get this added to Mamba Mk4 H743 V2?

issue.title: Mamba H743 V2 with ICM-42688 P Dual Gyro
issue.body: I have flashed this with iNav 6.1 Mamba H743 2022B and I notice that this gyro is not available in the drop downs in the configurator. It is responding to movement when I use ICM 42605. Is it safe or wise to use this? I assumed that ICM 42688 has been around for a while now so I assumed it would be supported in iNav -- or are the gyro options specified for each target? Can we get this added to Mamba Mk4 H743 V2?

comment.body: ICM426xx driver is enabled on `MAMBAH743_2022B` as well on `MAMBAF722_2022B`

issue.title: Enabled statistics may cause unexpected saving of configuration settings
issue.body: When stats are enabled they are written when disarming to the EEPROM. This has the side effect of saving all the changes made to the settings with the RC adjustments like the PIDs, board alignment, etc.

issue.title: Is there a screen offset setting for the OSD?
issue.body:
matek f722
Is there a screen offset setting for the OSD?
As in betaflight: https://github.com/betaflight/betaflight/wiki/OSD-and-CMS-Adjusting-Screen
I have a menu that goes beyond the screen, which can be fixed by what comand?

issue.title: Heading Hold Mode Problem
issue.body:
iNav Version: 1.9.0

Boards: Two quads with the same issue.  One is running ANYFCF7_EXTERNAL_BARO  and the other is SPRACINGF4EVO.

Problem: When running Heading Hold Mode (Mag Mode) after completing a left turn, the quad will intermittently (about once a flight) yaw back about 180 degrees to the right shortly after completing the turn.  It appears that the stick control to yaw to the left was not registered and the quad yaws back to its previous position that it was in just before starting the left turn.

Mag is properly calibrated and works correctly for all other functions such as RTH and POS-HOLD.

With Heading Hold Mode disabled, this problem does not occur.

I did not capture any logs and was hoping that this is a know or fixed issue.  If logs are required, I should be able to obtain the logs next weekend.

Thanks,

issue.title: Add automated efficiency mode and max current mode
issue.body:
Add a new option in the navigation configuration that would enable the microcontroller to automatically seek the most effiecient flight speed in terms of amps/km.

This would be helpful to enable the drone cover the most ground possible and adapt to varying wind speeds.

Also, adding a max current setting, that governs the throttle to prevent it from going over a set number would be useful in preventing damage to a drive train system.

Both of these features would require accurately calibrated current meters and proper warning should be added in place. 

Have these things ever been tried before?  I am curious what some devs think.

issue.title: suggest add Compass interference Warning to OSD message
issue.body: when compass was interference , the quad just lose control in GPS HOLD mode (very dangerous), suggest show a warning message on the OSD to tell pilot that there are interference and the compass can not work , and It is best to exit GPS HOLD mode at the same time .

issue.title: AUTOLAUNCH enhancement discussion
issue.body:
Hello everyone, as you may already know I'm interested in improving autolaunch mode.

I've came up with some ideas I want to share and discuss with you all.

1. Show launch phases on OSD (helps with planes without a buzzer for instance)
2. Add a "stage2" launch phase: This phase is intended to reduce the stress on batteries (which may be even cold) expecially LiOn batteries and also to reduce the average energy use during the launch phase.  My idea is to start reducing throttle and the pitch angle(to prevent a stall) after some seconds of climb (or at a specified climb rate).
3. Ability to configure some autolaunch parameter via the configurator

Do you have more suggestions? Ideas? Improvements?

issue.title: Multirotor RTH using GPS heading
issue.body:
Would it be possible to make a RTH feature work on multirotors without compass?  I've been trying to wrap my head around why this is not possible.   I understand it needs to have some groundspeed to calculate heading properly (hence it only being supported in fixed wing) but if the quad were to fly in a similar fashion to a wing with no compass present, I do not see why it would differ greatly.

Betaflight calculates direction to home by using gyro data under the assumption you plug the battery in pointing north.  The deviation is +- 10 degrees per flight (https://github.com/betaflight/betaflight/pull/4986), you could combine the gyro data with samples taken from the GPS heading during straight flight to get a reading which should be more than enough to work with navigation modes.

Seeing as how finicky compass can be, and how tiny GPS units like the micro ublox that lots of us put on racequads does not include a compass, it seems like this method might be very useful. 

Imaginary Scenario: 

1. RTH Engaged
2. Quad flies to RTH altitude
3. Quad angles pitch forward until GPS heading is calculated
4. Quad begins to correct for heading by continuing to fly forward but slowly yaw to point the nose towards home
5. Continue leaning forwards towards home, correcting yaw as necessary
6. When quad is within X of home, initiate landing (or loiter in circles like a wing)

I would be happy to try and contribute to the code on this feature, but I would definitely love to hear from folks who are more experienced in this stuff to determine the feasibility.  I don't have the breadth of knowledge required to build the skeleton of this.

issue.title: Multirotor Auto Launch Feature
issue.body: Would it be feasible to add an auto launch feature for multirotors that once activated will launch aircraft to a pre-defined height (eg. 2m above ground) with the aircraft in position and altitude hold mode?

issue.title: Flying/not flying detection
issue.body: Add some heuristics to figure out if we are flying or not to allow different behavior of i.e. failsafe mode.

issue.title: External I2C BMP280 disconnected but hardware still healthy
issue.body:
Boot the SPRACING F3 with connected external BMP280. Running 1.7.2 official.

Altitude is reported correctly.

Disconnect it from the board.

i2c errors count increases, baro still marked as healthy by configurator and still used by iNAV.

issue.title: Suggestion: Make nav_manual_speed and nav_manual_climb_rate profile specific settings
issue.body: Sometimes my kids like to fly my quadcopter. I've created a config profile that makes the copter fly more gentle so that it is easier for them (and safer for the copter...) while I can still make use of the capabilities of the machine with a more agressively tuned profile. I would also like to limit the max speed and climb rate the kids can go in CRUISE + ALT HOLD mode. What to you think about making nav_manual_speed and nav_manual_climb_rate profile specific settings, like most other settings that affect flight control characteristics? Maybe nav_auto_speed and nav_auto_climb_rate could be changed as well.

issue.title: Aerial 3D mapping
issue.body:
Hello, 
Would be great to add the feature in INAV with mission planner to take at selected moments a picture from a camera (servo output to send signal to the camera) to then create a 3D Aerial Map. 
Something similar as the APM feature would be great!
Regards,
Lucas FPV  
Example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2ZsO3LWtd9g

issue.title: Detect and counteract failed compass
issue.body:
I'm doing some experiments to check edge cases of sensor failure.

I'm using a custom NAZE target (F1) running 1.6RC2 on a breadboard using an MPU6050 and HMC5883 as compass.

I want to simulate a compass failure. After some seconds after I unplug the compass from the board the MAG icon became RED and this is ok. 

As soon I replug the compass at it's place the icon became blue again (meaning MAG is healthy) but in sensors tab magnetometer values are stuck and those wrong, stuck, values are sent into the IMU giving totally wrong result messing the machine heading computation.

I know this is a very unfortunate fault. 
So i've tried to unplug only SDA or SCL (leaving mag powered and configured) and I can again encouter the same issue most of the times.

Can we do something more to check the actual health of the mag and re-init it?  like heading is changing but mag value are not.

I'm here if needed

issue.title: Improve emergency landing
issue.body:
At the moment settings are harcoded for airplanes and emergency landing doesn't work for multi-rotors when baro fails.

We need to fix the landing procedure for multirotors and create a smarter one for airplanes.

issue.title: Improve RTH sanity checking
issue.body:
A continuation of #1034.
We need a safe enough procedure to detect failing RTH for both airplanes and multirotors.

issue.title: Run-time compass check
issue.body:
I figure failing compass is one most common cause of fly-aways. We need to implement run-time checking that compass is alive and kicking and treat compass loss the same way we do with GPS loss.

Also, compass failure in PosHold while GPS is still working good may result in FlyAway as PosHold controller doesn't protect itself against incorrect heading.

issue.title: Quaternion based level PIDs
issue.body:
As from a discussion from cleanflight:

There are benefits when using solely quaternion math for attitude calculations and level PIDs, since they avoid the singularity (gimbal lock) of the Euler angle representation. 

Even though these problems are not obvious in everyday usage, it's better to avoid them from the beginning on. 

I'm willing to invest time in this, but help is much appreciated!

This issue serves as an initial discussion thread.

One problem that arises is the stick mapping when allowing 90° stick mapping, roll will become yaw for example, and pilots need to discuss if this is intuitive.

issue.title: feature request: "Home Altitude" mode for RTH
issue.body:
Implement a 'home altitude' mode similar to what EagleTree Vector has.

http://eagletreesystems.com/Manuals/vector.pdf (page 80)

this would require three new CLI parameters:
- 'home alt mode'
- 'home alt radius'
- 'home alt height'

'home alt mode' values:
- disabled: ignore 'home alt mode' settings
- normal: ascend / descend to 'home alt height' if within 'home alt radius'
- glide (only for FW); glide down with throttle off if within 'home alt radius' (perhaps we can improve on this to avoid stalls? maybe an option to glide in for landing with min throttle?)

The vector manual explains it pretty clearly. It doesn't seem like it should be too difficult to implement. Thoughts?

issue.title: NAV - add cross track error support for FW
issue.body:
more info:
http://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=10263920&postcount=12
http://diydrones.com/forum/topics/anyone-knows-how-to-measure-the-lateral-crosstrack-error

issue.title: IMU - Accel and Gyro temperature compensation
issue.body:
I've been testing CC3D outside today and noticed that estimated attitude drifted a lot after I move the board from the room (+20 deg) to the outside (-25 deg). And by a lot I mean almost 70 degrees.

**imu_dcm_ki** was doing great job canceling gyro temperature bias, but the problem was accelerometer itself. It was also offset by low temperature and that was confusing the IMU.

We need a way to compensate for this temperature drift.

issue.title: Rally point option
issue.body: Would be useful for longer-range flights. See here for description:  http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-rally-points/

issue.title: Geofence option
issue.body:
- RTH if distance from home > threshold
- RTH if stepping out of a user-defined polygon

issue.title: Improve scheduler with a possibility to yield a long-running task
issue.body: and not task switch to scheduler? I don't know how it here but profiling of Arducopter shows 67% of CPU time just in delay()

issue.title: [4.0-rc1] Auto-CRUISE-3D?
issue.body:
I had 4.0-rc1 on plane (i know that rc2 is available, but at this time i had only rc1). Was out on field and by accident put too much P on  pitch axis.
Take off, noticed oscillations, switched to manual, prepared to land, turned off acro/angle, overshoot, angle mode WOT, oscillations and:

- expected - some oscillations, i turn on manual, they stop, i do another circle, land and adjust PID's
- reality - airplane got into strange CRUISE-3D mode (at least blackbox says so), i had no controls on roll/pitch (at least, noticeable) while loosing altitude at the same time, added throttle to fly over road and ended up in forest (no damage to plane)

Now looking into blackbox (3% - sorry, no better resolution) i see that i have clear markers where flight mode has changed (angle, manual and so on), but no marker on last mode change (in blackbox log drama starts at 2:15). But on values table i see that plane got into CRUISE 3D mode. I have NAV_CRUISE on switch, but that switch not close to throttle/angle/attitude controls, i really, really doubt i could trigger it by accident.
Even if i triggered that CRUISE-3D mode - there are still questions:

- why it did not hold altitude? In DVR altitude acts strange (that mode is on from ~00:07 in video) - it was quickly loosing altitude, then reset, then again loosing alt (plane itself cruises at ~10% thr, it's overpowered wing and even unpowered glide ratio is way better than i see in video)
- why there is no mode change line in blackbox?

In my opinion - this cruise mode was triggered by some glitch after oscillations. Any comments?

[cruise_g_diff.txt](https://github.com/iNavFlight/inav/files/7658955/cruise_g_diff.txt)
[blackbox_log_2021-12-05_231159.zip](https://github.com/iNavFlight/inav/files/7658884/blackbox_log_2021-12-05_231159.zip)
Flight video (last seconds): https://youtu.be/K37tptYSjBs

issue.title: High CPU load on fresh build with SD card installed
issue.body:
Brand new F765 WSE with a 16 gig UHC3 sd card in the sd card slot, i get 75% cpu usage and cannot get into anything  whhen the card is inserted. card removed evrything is fine.

tested with multiple sized and speeds of card, including working BB SD cards from other airframes with the same controller.

thoughts?

issue.title: Blackbox times out with Matek F405mini with inav 4.0
issue.body:
Current Behavior
Selecting the blackbox logs in inav 4.0 configurator on a Matek F405 mini just times out.  (I have two and it does it on both) It works fine in inav 4.0 on a Matek F405SE and a FlywooF411V2 FC.

Steps to Reproduce
<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior: -->
1.  Update Matek F405 to inav 4.0
2.   Try and access the blackbox tab in inav configurator 4.0
3.   Watch it just say Waiting for data... and time out.

Expected behavior
Should be able to access the blackbox logs tab and download the blackbox files

## Suggested solution(s)
<!-- How could we solve this issue? What changes would need to made to INAV? -->

## Additional context
inav 4.0 dump https://pastebin.com/NviVrzv3 

- FC Board name and vendor:  INAV/MATEKF405 4.0.0 Dec 15 2021 / 14:53:05 (c20a9852)
- INAV version string: GCC-10.2.1 20201103 (release)

issue.title: INAV 5: After Landing not able to arm due to "CLI ACTIVE"
issue.body:
## Current Behavior
I was flying my fresh configured INAV 5 Wing yesterday and landed it after 50m (launch aborted- to little throttle). After having the wing at hand again I wanted to ARM and launch it again.

This wasn't possible at that moment as the OSD reported "unable to ARM CLI ACTIVE". I repowered the wing and everything was ok again. 

## Steps to Reproduce
currently I don't know how to reproduce this without just mumbling speculations - 

## Expected behavior
don't block the arming as no USB was connected and CLI wasn't used.

## Suggested solution(s)
ARM :) ... 

## Additional context
Here is a video of it
 
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8381714/177255416-e0b77922-10b3-427e-899a-7cb6795b6ff1.mov

---

- FC Board name and vendor: MATEKF405SE
- INAV version string: 5.0.0 (3a379a7)
